#summary How to use Ant to compile your JavaScript

As of the Feb 1, 2010 release, Closure Compiler has an [http://ant.apache.org/ Apache Ant] task implementation.

Here is an example of a build.xml file that uses Closure Compiler.

{{{
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<project basedir="." default="compile">

  <taskdef name="jscomp" classname="com.google.javascript.jscomp.ant.CompileTask"
           classpath="../build/compiler.jar"/>

  <target name="compile">
    
    <jscomp compilationLevel="simple" warning="verbose" 
	    debug="false" output="output/file.js">

      <externs dir="${basedir}/src">
        <file name="extern.js"/>
      </externs>

      <sources dir="${basedir}/src">
        <file name="simple1.js"/>
        <file name="simple2.js"/>
      </sources>

      <sources dir="${basedir}/other">
        <file name="simple3.js"/>
      </sources>

    </jscomp>
    
  </target>

</project>
}}}
